qas.question: What other architecture style did neoclassical share similarities and vocabulary?
What qualities were more emphasized in neoclassical versus Baroque?

answers.text: planar qualities, rather than sculptural volumes

qas.question: In addition to being flatter, how were individual features handled with neoclasic?
How broad was the reach of high neoclassicism?
What used a different vocabulary then late Baroque architecture?
What architectural features had a less flat effect on light and shade?
What architectural style had less isolated features?

context: High <b4_0><b8_0>neoclassicism<b8_0/><b4_0/> was an <a3_0>international movement<a3_0/>. Though <b5_0><b6_0>neoclassical architecture<b6_0/><b5_0/> employed the same classical vocabulary as <a0_0>Late Baroque architecture<a0_0/>, it tended to emphasize its <a1_0>planar qualities, rather than sculptural volumes<a1_0/>. <b7_0>Projections and recessions<b7_0/> and their effects of light and shade were more flat; sculptural bas-reliefs were flatter and tended to be enframed in friezes, tablets or panels. Its clearly articulated individual features were <a2_0>isolated rather than interpenetrating<a2_0/>, autonomous and complete in themselves.
